comments:
0425 nightly build
I'm guessing Debug-UI since this happens in the Run... dialog

- click the drop-down arrow portion of the Run... ToolItem
- select Run As-> Eclipse Application
- shut down the just-started self-hosted Eclipse
- now click the drop-down arrow portion of the Run... ToolItem again
- this time select Run... and you'll get the exception below
  -> I did a quick investigation: there's a ScrolledPageBook that has a GridData
layout data object on it instead of the expected FillData layout data object; I
did not try to track down where this layout data is being set.

This is a problem in SWT. It happens in every TitleAreaDialog now when we update
the message.

You can also see this by selecing a new wizard.
*** Bug 92780 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The issue for this one is that the ScrolledPageBook has a GridData for a layoutData.

The parent is a composite whose Layout is a FillLayout so I think this is a
simple case of mismatched layouts and layout datas.

I can't make this happen for the new wizard using SWT from HEAD in 20050420 so
I'll dig deeper to make sure I was right.

Darin it may be yours after all - sorry if I got it mixed up.

Ok I was wrong. The problem I saw was actually this one - sorry.

I suspect this issue has been there for a while and some of the work SWT did on
the 20th of April exposed it.

Setting a GridData into a widget whose parent uses a FillLayout has been 
accidentally tollerated up until now because FillLayout's implementation has 
never looked at the layout data on child widgets.  For internal purposes it now 
does though, so this problem is now surfacing.

It should just be a matter of not setting the problematic GridData, since 
FillLayout was not actually using it before anyways.
If you roll back to 1.23 of FillLayout this no longer occurs.

Shouldn't this be fixed in FillLayout? It should be careful about 
casting/checking instanceof?

That would be inconsistent with the way the other layout classes work and might
cause a performance hit with extra instanceof checks.

Only happens on Runtime workbench and JUnit plug-in test launch configs. 
Moving to PDE. (I assume the culprit is on a launch config tab).

the tracing tab exhibited this layout faux-pas.
Fixed.  Will ask for a rebuild.
*** Bug 92956 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
